data.title: 12 beggars arrested in Bangkok,1 with B300,000 cash, B1m in bank account
data.description: Twelve Thai and foreign beggars were arrested during a police operation to purge Bangkok of beggars on Thursday night. One Thai beggar was found to be carrying more than 300,000 baht in cash and to have about one million baht in her bank account

data.title: Chinese student loses over B2.3m to Hong Kong scammers who told her to go to Thailand
data.description: A master

data.title: FTAs help boost Thailand’s dairy exports by 11.5% year on year
data.description: Milk and other dairy products generated $605 million sales in first 10 months of 2024

data.title: Filipina on Indonesia death row says planned transfer 'miracle'
data.description: A Filipina drug convict on death row in Indonesia told AFP from prison Friday that her planned transfer was a "miracle", in her first interview since Manila and Jakarta signed an agreement last week to repatriate her.

data.title: 889 tourists evacuated as Phu Kradueng shuts down for safety reasons
data.description: The national park in Loei has been closed indefinitely after a wild elephant fatally attacked a tourist on Wednesday

data.title: In authoritarian echo, Indonesia president suggests scrapping regional elections
data.description: JAKARTA - Indonesia

data.title: Thaksin joins Pheu Thai train trip to seaside seminar
data.description: Patriarch joins daughter, PM Paetongtarn, and ruling party MPs for meeting in Hua Hin

data.title: Body of Thai man who jumped into river to escape Malaysian police found
data.description: NARATHIWAT - Rescuers found the body of a Thai citizen on Friday three days after he jumped into the Golok River to escape arrest by Malaysian police while trying to enter the neighbouring country through an illegal route.

data.title: Feel the holiday spirit: Top Thai movies to watch this Christmas
data.description: Whether you go for romance, drama or comedy, these are the best Thai films to watch during the upcoming holiday season. The festive season is almost upon us, bringing with it cosy nights, warm drinks, and heartwarming traditions.

data.title: Gulf Energy’s Sarath tops Thailand’s richest shareholders list again
data.description: Portfolio worth over 240 billion baht outpaces M-150 tycoon Niti (59.47 billion) and medical/airline mogul Prasert (50.65 billion)

data.title: Five members of Chinese-led 'scam network' arrested in Chon Buri
data.description: Five more alleged members of a Chinese scam network have been arrested and assets, including luxury houses and cars, worth 152 million baht seized during a raid in Bang Lamung district, Chon Buri.

data.title: Five members of Chinese-led 'scam network' arrested in Chon Buri
data.description: Five more alleged members of a Chinese scam network have been arrested and assets, including luxury houses and cars, worth 152 million baht seized during a raid in Bang Lamung district, Chon Buri.

data.title: IRPC Wins Gold Award for Outstanding Human Rights Commitment
data.description: IRPC Public Co., Ltd. (IRPC), led by President and CEO Terdkiat Prommool, has been awarded the Gold Award for Outstanding Organisation in Human Rights for the fifth consecutive year. The honour was presented by Police Colonel Tawee Sodsong, Minister of Justice, at a ceremony hosted by the Department of Rights and Liberties Protection, Ministry of Justice, at the Miracle Grand Convention Hotel.

data.title: China says Philippines has 'provoked trouble' in S.China Sea with US backing
data.description: BEIJING - China accused the Philippines on Friday of having "provoked trouble" in the South China Sea with US backing, a week after Beijing and Manila traded accusations over a new confrontation in the disputed waters.

data.title: “Light of Heart” Maternity Unit Opens in Tak
data.description: The Dhanin Tawee Chearavanont Foundation, in collaboration with Umphang Hospital, inaugurated the “Light of Heart” maternity unit in Baan Pengkleng, Umphang District, Tak Province.

data.title: Taiwan says China's threat towards island has been evolving
data.description: TAIPEI - Taiwan

data.title: Thai businesses satisfied with govt’s achievements in first 90 days
data.description: Business sector praises the administration’s initiatives, but wants to see more robust economic stimulation measures in 2025

data.title: An epicurean journey begins: Skyview Hotel Bangkok announces exclusive wine pairing dinner with new Executive Chef Dessi De Vries
data.description: Bangkok, 22 November 2024 — Skyview Hotel Bangkok is thrilled to announce the appointment of Chef Dessi De Vries as its new Executive Chef, ushering in a new era of culinary excellence.

data.title: Beacon VC Accelerates Sustainable Innovation with US$13 Million Investment Portfolio
data.description: Beacon Venture Capital Company Limited (Beacon VC), a venture capital firm backed by KASIKORNBANK, is accelerating its mission to foster sustainable innovation in Southeast Asia.

data.title: Russia eyes increasing cooperation with Thailand under BRICS
data.description: Russian ambassador outlines opportunities for closer collaboration and trade in several sectors including energy

data.title: Six arrested over call centre scams in southern Thailand
data.description: Police arrested six people allegedly involved in call centre scams and the illegal firearms trade, the Cyber Crime Investigation Bureau (CCIB) announced yesterday, saying the suspects may have also financed the insurgency in the deep South.

data.title: Government’s rice export policy ‘selling a dream’, experts say
data.description: Thai Rice Exporters Association points out that only the high fees for documentation prevent farmers and SMEs from exporting their rice

data.title: Hygiene stressed amid Norovirus outbreak in China
data.description: The Norovirus outbreak has affected multiple areas in China, with infections spreading since October. While everyone is generally susceptible to the virus, many school students have been impacted, including three classes at Zhejiang Road Primary School , where lessons have shifted online.

data.title: A seat at the table – young people in Thailand call for a bigger role in climate action
data.description: Youth advocates today submitted climate action recommendations to the Royal Thai Government. The recommendations drew on a national Suan Dusit Poll of nearly 1,000 children and young people across Thailand, followed by one-to-one discussions between UNICEF and young representatives.
